text: Water clear, light floral some pear coconut, rice. Eatery texture mild alcoholic, seems light but will burn in after a while. Dry finish. A bit weak.

Bottle shared with my wife. Pours clear. Soft melon and banana, warmed rice. Medium bodied, warm alcohol right away. Fusel alcohol, just tastes boozy. Warm alcohol, sweet melon and strawberry rice on the finish.
Pours crystal clear.  Aroma of honeydew melon.  Buttery mouthfeel.  Warming alcohol finish. Quite refreshing and tasty.
Bottle. Melon, vanilla. Very smooth finish. High alcohol is well integrated.

Cream cheese, elmers glue, and honeydew nose. Crystal clear and very pale yellow.  Very light honeydew flavor, actual honey at midpalate. Chemical undercurrent throughout. Burns on the back end. Watery and astringent. Weak and not very good.
bottle, thanks to mar, clear as water pour with slightest legs, aromas of coconut and bamboo, flavor is coconut, bamboo shoots

(300ml bottle thanks to mar) clear still with laser-etched alcohol legs. Nose of rice, smooth well integrated alcohol, and peach. Taste of alcohol, very smooth, rice, and peaches with a medium thick body. Extremely smooth finish. Nice.
(300ml bottle, courtesy of mar)  Pours a transparent body with excellent legs.  Aroma of vanilla, marzipan, and almonds.  Flavor of melon, vanilla, pear, and light florals.
Thanks to mar for sharing this bottle. Clear. I get alcohol with some rice and vanilla. Not too complex but not bad.
Clear with semi decent legs.  Nose is alcohol, light nuts, vanilla, and florals.   Decent thickness on the palate, flavor is not big on alcohol, nutty with a floral finish.

300ml bottle from Japan pavilion at Disney. Pours with no extra hints of color. Dry rice, fruit, alcohol aroma. Taste is yeasty, bread, with touches of light fruit and continued dryness. Nice light and tasty.
Pours clear and still.  Smells of rice and boozy.  Tastes dry with some nice warming alcohol on the finish.  Some fruitiness emerges as the sake warms.

(300 ml bottle from Lous Beverage Barn (I asume I have the correct sake here although I dont recall the word "Tokusen" on the label) Pours clear with a very slight golden tint. Aroma of bread, yeast, rice and alcohol. Mouthfeel light, thin, lightly dryish. Lacing consists of some droplets along inside of glass. Flavor of bread and alcohol with overtones of yeast and rice. Perhaps less sweet than some other sakes Ive had. Nice and easy to drink. Served chilled.

Pours a greenish yellow color. 300 ml bottle. Rice aroma, with almost no fruit. Taste is a bit dry but the mouhtfeel is a little harsh. I like my sake smoother.Not much to say on this one....lacking in flavor and appears to not be made very well.

300 ml bottle from City Market in Burlington, VT (December 2007), consumed from the fridge in a White Winter Winery glass.  Extremely clear and still, just a faint oily haze to it; very faint legs in the glass indicate little sugar.....more pronounced "riciness" in the nose, reminds me of the home-made horchata at a Mexican restaurant I used to visit frequently in Chicago; hints of almonds....smooth, lightly sweet body, less tropical-fruity than most, a bit of almond and vanilla in the ricey character, hint of alcohol at first grows fairly strong towards the finish, but the dryness of palate really works here and the overall character is a bit reminiscent of gin or a high-quality vodka, without the burn....elegant and quite pleasant.

Courtesy redlight.  Pours clear.  Smell is kind of bready, yeasty, a little nutty even.  The taste is defintely kind of bready or doughy, if those are words, with just a touch of some light vanilla I think.  I find it kind of difficult to characterize flavors in sake.  The differences are kind of subtle.  I still enjoyed it though.  I am more and more becoming a fan of sake.
Koji, yeasty aroma, cereal.  Pours clear.  Tart koji and rice, cereal, very clean flavor noticable alcohol.
ColdTransparent color. Simple aroma. Dry mouthfeel, too much alcoholic, no remarkable flavor.

300ml bottle... Looks like water. Vanilla, raw almond, alcoholic nose. Lightly sweet, lightly tangy. A bit thin, actually. Medium-bodied. Finishes alcohol-warm then very dry. Im not a fan. Probably the last sake Ill try.

Clear, no color. Koji, Vanilla, almonds and slight alcohol in the nose. Slightly thick feeling (for a Honjozo), Id expect a bit lighter, fruitier and aromatic for this style.
Mild nutty flavor up front, a bit harsh in the follow with an alcohol burn going down. Not a top notch sake (IMHO) but certainly not a bad one either.

From a bottle at Sushi Joy- Plymouth, MA. Dusky floral aroma of light plum and fragant blossom. A touch of tangy soy. An off-clear pour. Flavor has a generally sweetly cured alcohol with light herbaceous lemon, heavy coconut and some touches of plum or pear. A heavier toasted wood develops from teh depths, with a hint of bamboo and coral. Alcohol isnt too overbearing, instead gentle, but warming and fragrant in the nostrils. Finishes with a touch of tart lemon on the palate.

mildly sweet aroma some alcohol.  Reall smooth drink but kinda light on the palate it had sweet flavor but it seemed watereed down too much.  hand a nice dry finish and the alcohol seemed to be well hidden in the flavor.

Medium bodied - smooth and slightly thick.  Aroma is sweet and vanilla.  Taste is full bodied and changes over time - vanilla, oak, some alcohol, sweet candy (yeah, I agree, theres a hint of caramel here, especially when warmer).  Finish is dry then followed by a lingering sweetness.  Nice mellow sake.
clear pour. aroma of coconut, vanilla, and very woody. nutty flavor with an ashy dry mouthfeel. lingering jelly bean mouthfeel. enjoyable. i taste some caramel here.
